job_description: Datadog Notebooks provide customers with a collaborative surface for ad-hoc data-exploration, technical documentation, incident postmortems, runbooks and advanced data analysis.Think of it as if Google doc / Notion and jupyter notebooks had a baby. As a Senior Product Manager, Notebooks, you will engage directly with customers to gather their requirements, and collaborate with Product Managers and Engineering Leaders from multiple internal teams to augment the shared capabilities of our 20+ product suite. You will operate at the intersection of documentation, collaboration, data visualization, observability and business intelligence.Notebooks are used by a fairly small but growing and passionate set of our user base, and there’s tremendous potential to grow it to new heights. At Datadog, we place value in our office culture - the relationships and collaboration it builds, and the creativity it brings to the table. We operate as a hybrid workplace to ensure our Datadogs can create a work-life harmony that best fits them.What you’ll do:Drive an ambitious product vision and roadmap for NotebooksPartner with customers and understand our users (software developers, ops engineers) deeply; design solutions they find intuitive and delightfulScope, spec, and design new features, working with a cross-functional team of product managers, product designers, engineers, and analysts to achieve product-market fit for new initiativesContinuously monitor product performance, analyze key metrics, and iterate on the product to optimize user experience and business impactWork with marketing and customer success teams to evangelize new features and services that are easy to use and understandIndependently research the market and competitionImmerse yourself in everything monitoring (theory, applications, best practices) and pour your expertise and ideas back into building a great productWho you are: You have 5+ years of experience in B2B SaaS Product Management Experience in enterprise software serving a technical audience and / or data visualization / analysis software is a strong plusYou have domain knowledge of data visualization, data insights or business intelligenceYou have a strong sense of ownership with an entrepreneurial spirit with a bias for action and business results, able to thrive in a fast-paced, dynamic environmentStrong analytical mindset with the ability to interpret complex data and derive actionable insights to drive product strategyYou have sharp communication skills and the willingness to present your ideas to technical stakeholders and executives alikeYou have a Bachelor's Degree in Engineering, Computer Science, Information Technology, Data Visualization, Data Engineering or equivalent experience.Datadog values people from all walks of life. We understand not everyone will meet all the above qualifications on day one. That's okay. If you’re passionate about technology and want to grow your skills, we encourage you to apply.Benefits & Growth:Product training to develop an in-depth understanding of our product and spaceContinuous career development and pathing opportunities for internal mobility Intra-departmental mentor and buddy program for in-house networking An inclusive company culture, ability to join our Community GuildsNew hire stock equity (RSUs) and employee stock purchase plan (ESPP)Free global mental health benefit through Spring Health Generous global benefits Benefits and Growth listed above may vary based on the country of your employment and the nature of your employment with Datadog.Datadog offers a competitive salary and equity package, and may include variable compensation. Actual compensation is based on factors such as the candidate's skills, qualifications, and experience. title: Senior Product Manager - Notebooks

job_description: We're on a mission to build the best platform in the world for engineers to understand and scale their systems, applications, and teams. We operate at high scale—trillions of data points per day—allowing for seamless collaboration and problem-solving among Dev, Ops and Security teams globally for tens of thousands of companies. Our engineering culture values pragmatism, honesty, and simplicity to solve hard problems the right way.The Team:Logs are critical to ensuring the availability, security/compliance and performance of modern applications, but as log volumes grow exponentially year over year, realizing value from the mountain of data becomes increasingly difficult and expensive. Datadog’s Log Management is a next generation, AI-first log warehousing and analytics product, committed to giving our customers the fastest, most-flexible, and easy to use log exploration experience - from event generation to query - while helping them maintain a healthy budget even as their log volumes are exploding with rise in AI focused development. The Opportunity:The Senior PM - Flex Logs role is responsible for defining and bringing to market the next generation of log retention and access capabilities on top of our modern Third-Generation Event Store in an AI-first environment. This role is highly technical and creative in nature as you will envision novel ways to enable customers to cost-effectively explore, analyze and report over petabytes of data through a welcoming and easy-to-use interface. You will partner with various teams to take advantage of BitsAI capabilities and surface critical insights on volume usage and retention for popular use cases.At Datadog, we place value in our office culture - the relationships and collaboration it builds and the creativity it brings to the table. We operate as a hybrid workplace to ensure our Datadogs can create a work-life harmony that best fits them.What You’ll Do:Define the vision, strategy, and product roadmap for Flex Logs and make it immediately valuable to customers in an AI-first environmentGather insights from customers, partners, and internal data to become an expert on how customers want to store, analyze, and report on data for long term needsWork closely with Datadog’s Platform, BitsAI, and SIEM teams to identify opportunities and build capabilities for dynamic data tiering strategiesCollaborate with Engineering to surface insights and utilization metrics for Flex Logs to help customers make better decisions on their Flex Storage and Compute usageRecommend and launch new offerings with Flex Logs based on use cases for Security and CompliancePartner with Marketing and other GTM teams to generate awareness and drive adoption of Datadog’s Flex Logs offeringGuide Product Solution Architects to write blogs and how-to guides on getting started with Flex Logs for specific use cases and industry verticalsWho You Are: A Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science or Engineering or equivalent experience5+ years of experience in B2B SaaS Product ManagementAt least 2+ years of experience with databases, data warehouses, SQL concepts & language, BI products, and/or distributed systemsHands on experience using multiple services from one or more of the major cloud providers (AWS, Microsoft Azure, Google Cloud)Demonstrated track record of shipping successful data reporting and data workflow product offerings in the cloudPrior experience with Snowflake, Databricks, Splunk, or ClickHouse is a strong plusDatadog values people from all walks of life. We know not everyone will meet all the above qualifications on day one. That’s okay. If you’re passionate about technology and want to grow your experience, we encourage you to apply. title: Senior Product Manager - Flex Logs

job_description: Customers depend on Datadog’s Incident Management product in crisis moments — when outages threaten their business — and your work will shape how teams respond and learn.As a Product Manager II, you’ll own the product that turns chaos into calm: declaring incidents, rallying responders, coordinating remediation, and turning every outage into a learning opportunity that prevents the next one. This is a broad, technically rich product — you’ll own features across real-time UIs, automation, AI-powered summaries and recommendations, documentation and runbooks, task and incident state management, analytics, and deep integrations with third-party chat and video platforms.You’ll own the features that reduce Mean Time to Resolution (MTTR) for some of the world’s most complex cloud systems, partnering closely with the rest of the product organization to deliver end-to-end incident response. Your work will be highly visible to customers and internal stakeholders and will shape how organizations run reliable services at scale.Datadog is uniquely positioned to deliver best-in-class end-to-end incident response by surfacing the right telemetry (metrics, traces, logs), orchestrating responders through alerting and paging, and closing the loop with automation and incident management.At Datadog, we place value in our office culture - the relationships and collaboration it builds and the creativity it brings to the table. We operate as a hybrid workplace to ensure our Datadogs can create a work-life harmony that best fits them.What You’ll Do: Develop a deep understanding of the incident process of our our dev, ops, and security customersOwn the end-to-end product management process for the Incident Management product within DatadogShip features to help our customers respond to outages fasterBe accountable for the growth of the Datadog incident management productWork with Design and Engineering teams to develop product priorities and roadmaps that inspire our teams’ best work and deliver real value Work with the Sales, Account Management, Marketing and Solutions teams to close deals and support existing customersDefine Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) for the product and report on them to business and executive leadershipWho You Are:An experienced Product Manager, ideally at a SaaS company You are customer-minded with a high quality standard for the product to be deliveredYou have excellent verbal and written communication skills and the willingness to present and defend your ideas to both technical and non-technical audiencesYou have a strong sense of the day in the life of an engineer who holds a pager.You have Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science or Engineering or equivalent experienceDatadog values people from all walks of life. We know not everyone will meet all the above qualifications on day one. That’s okay. If you’re passionate about technology and want to grow your experience, we encourage you to apply. job_title: Product Manager II - Software Delivery Suite
job_description: At Datadog, we're on a relentless mission to build the best platform in the world for engineers to truly understand and scale their systems, applications, and teams. Operating at an unprecedented scale - processing trillions of data points per day - we empower seamless collaboration and problem-solving for tens of thousands of companies globally. Our engineering culture thrives on pragmatism, honesty, and simplicity, tackling complex challenges the right way. SDLC ObservabilityDatadog's Software Delivery Platform starts with a comprehensive, end-to-end visibility across the entire SDLC, helping customers catch issues before production, optimize costs, and accelerate delivery. Our product suite includes granular insights into CI/CD pipelines, intelligent test management and optimization, code quality gates, and automated DORA metrics across every major CI provider. This is more than monitoring; it's about preventing failures, removing bottlenecks and eliminating developer disruptions at scale.Runtime, Machine learning and CuriosityThis role requires a continued curiosity to explore uncharted spaces while innovating in more established ones. With the rise of AI-generated code, the volume of Pull Requests, CI runs, and Tests is growing fast, creating more noise, higher costs, and new bottlenecks for engineering teams.We’re tackling the impact of that growth on SDLC by absorbing and root-cause fixing CI instability, and generating/updating/orchestrating thousands of tests using production signals and quantifying how AI impacts SDLC. We have an appetite to solve hard problems in clever ways. Our users trust us with their observability data and we work hard to put it to good use for them. At Datadog, we are looking for a Product Manager II to help us evolve the Software Delivery Suit to work on all these spaces to help developers ship faster, safer, and with less cognitive load. At Datadog, we place value in our office culture - the relationships and collaboration it builds, and the creativity it brings to the table. We operate as a hybrid workplace to ensure our Datadogs can create a work-life harmony that best fits them.What You’ll DoUncover Developer / Platform Eng Needs: You will conduct user research and analyze usage data to understand how teams at different scales (from startups to massive enterprises) struggle with pipeline noise, testing and deployment risk.Owning and accelerating parts of the Software Delivery business: Drive adoption of CI/CD Visibility, Test Optimization, and Code Quality products, optimize customer onboarding, and ensure robust revenue growth across Platform Engineers and Developers.Define the experience: From intuitive pipeline visibility to intelligent test selection, quality gates, and Auto Test generation - ensuring every developer ships code with confidence and speed.Strategize to win the market: Partner with Product Marketing and Sales to perfect positioning while enabling field teams to articulate how we help in the larger Datadog suite.Who You AreProduct Thinker: You have 3-5 years of experience in Product Management or a combined background in Engineering/DevOps and Product. You understand how to break down big problems into shippable iterations.Developer Empathy: You have a technical background or a strong familiarity with the SDLC. You understand concepts like CI pipelines (GitHub Actions, GitLab), Test Flakiness, Deployment strategies (Canary, Blue/Green), and why developers hate being blocked by infrastructure.Data-Driven: You are comfortable with analytics tools to query usage data, prove a hypothesis, and measure the success of a feature launch.Adaptable: You are comfortable with ambiguity. Our strategy involves moving fast to solve new problems created by AI coding assistants; you are excited to pivot focus between Testing, CI, and Deployments based on where the biggest value lies.Collaborator: You have excellent communication skills and can work effectively with distributed engineering teams, building consensus and keeping projects on track.Datadog values people from all walks of life. We understand not everyone will meet all the above qualifications on day one. That's okay. If you’re passionate about technology and want to grow your skills, we encourage you to apply.Benefits & Growth:New hire stock equity (RSUs) and employee stock purchase plan (ESPP)Continuous professional development, product training, and career pathingComprehensive health, dental, and vision coverageQuarterly Datadog Days (company-wide mental health days)Annual DASH conference and team offsitesDog-friendly offices and inclusive company cultureAccess to Community Guilds and Inclusion TalksCompetitive compensation targeting 75th percentile of marketBenefits and Growth listed above may vary based on the country of your employment and the nature of your employment with Datadog. Datadog offers a competitive salary and equity package, and may include variable compensation. Actual compensation is based on factors such as the candidate's skills, qualifications, and experience. In addition, Datadog offers a wide range of best in class, comprehensive and inclusive employee benefits for this role including healthcare, dental, parental planning, and mental health benefits, a 401(k) plan and match, paid time off, fitness reimbursements, and a discounted employee stock purchase plan.The reasonably estimated yearly salary for this role at Datadog is:$187,000—$240,000 USDAbout Datadog: Datadog (NASDAQ: DDOG) is a global SaaS business, delivering a rare combination of growth and profitability. We are on a mission to break down silos and solve complexity in the cloud age by enabling digital transformation, cloud migration, and infrastructure monitoring of our customers’ entire technology stacks. Built by engineers, for engineers, Datadog is used by organizations of all sizes across a wide range of industries. title: Product Manager II - Software Delivery Suite

job_description: The opportunityDatadog’s APM Experiences team owns the core product experience for Application Performance Monitoring — including distributed tracing, service representation, and more. We’re building a new wave of AI-powered capabilities that help customers detect, resolve, and prevent performance issues faster. In this role, you will lead end‑to‑end development of LLM- and Agent‑based features that can:Debug and investigate application performance issues down to the root cause, as both a developer assistant and a fully autonomous agentProactively recommend performance and reliability-based optimizations to prevent the next incidentAutomatically create intelligent monitors and SLOs for the most important business flows and critical pathsThis is a highly product‑minded engineering role: you’ll work from problem discovery and UX all the way to reliable, scalable production systems.What you’ll doShape AI experiences for APM. Design and ship LLM/agentic workflows that analyze traces, metrics, logs, and other telemetry to generate diagnoses, explanations, and guided fixes.Own the full loop. Prototype quickly, define success metrics and evals, run experiments, iterate, and ultimately productionize for scale and reliability.Build robust agent systems. Develop tools, retrieval and planning strategies, and guardrails; manage prompts/evals; design fallbacks and human‑in‑the‑loop paths.Integrate with Datadog’s platform. Leverage surfaces like Trace Explorer, Service Catalog, monitors, and workflows to deliver end‑to‑end value in the APM UI.Partner deeply. Collaborate with PM, Design, and partner teams to build cohesive experiences.Raise the bar on engineering. Write performant, maintainable backend code, own services in production, and improve reliability for high‑throughput, low‑latency data systems.Who you areProduct‑minded engineer who ships AI to production4+ years building backend or real-time ML systems; you value simplicity, correctness, and performanceProven experience delivering LLM/agent features to production (prompting, tooling, evals, safety/guardrails)Comfortable owning user journeys, iterating from prototype → alpha → GA, and measuring impact with clear product metricsStrong ML / applied science fundamentalsSolid grasp of the ML lifecycle (task definition, dataset collection, modeling, evaluation, deployment, iteration) and statistics (experiment design, confidence intervals)Experience choosing/modeling the right technique for the job (e.g., anomaly detection, ranking/recommendation, NLP), and knowing when a heuristic beats a modelFluency with offline/online evals for AI systems; can build reliable golden sets and automatic regressionsDistributed systems & observability savvyExperience with microservices performance: tracing, latency breakdowns, concurrency, and resiliency patternsProficient in Go, Java, or Python; strong API/service design; production ops (monitoring, alerting, on‑call rotation)Nice to haveHands‑on with distributed tracing stacks (OpenTelemetry/Datadog APM), profilers, and logs/metrics pipelinesExposure to planning/agent frameworks, tool‑use orchestration, RAG, and retrieval/indexing for observability dataFamiliarity with SLO/SLA practices and incident responseBenefits and Growth:Get to build tools for software engineers, just like yourself. And use the tools we build to accelerate our development.Have a lot of influence on product direction and impact on the business.Work with skilled, knowledgeable, and kind teammates who are happy to teach and learn.Competitive global benefits.Continuous professional development.Benefits and Growth listed above may vary based on the country of your employment and the nature of your employment with Datadog. Datadog offers a competitive salary and equity package, and may include variable compensation. Actual compensation is based on factors such as the candidate's skills, qualifications, and experience. In addition, Datadog offers a wide range of best in class, comprehensive and inclusive employee benefits for this role including healthcare, dental, parental planning, and mental health benefits, a 401(k) plan and match, paid time off, fitness reimbursements, and a discounted employee stock purchase plan.The reasonably estimated yearly salary for this role at Datadog is:$187,000—$240,000 USDAbout Datadog: Datadog (NASDAQ: DDOG) is a global SaaS business, delivering a rare combination of growth and profitability. job_description: Our GTM Enablement team is a unique strategy, curriculum, and operations team that plays an integral part in connecting our go-to-market approach and curriculum to customer value. We’re interdisciplinary thinkers leveraging diverse business backgrounds in engineering, education, management consulting, business operations (and more!) to define, manage and measure Datadog’s global go to market motion. We empower all of Datadog’s customer-facing teams with the right information, skills, and tools at the right time in order to maximize their ability to land, expand and drive Datadog’s next phase of growth. The Opportunity:The Senior Sales Enablement Associate will serve as our operations guru, our knowledge management wiz, and our process efficiency extraordinaire to help design our systems to ensure our rapidly growing global GTM Enablement teams work at-scale. We are looking for someone who has a passion for scaling programs, maintains organization, and is the heartbeat of our team’s logistics strategy. This role has the opportunity to grow into a sales enablement curriculum role. What You’ll Do:Design logistics & operations for new programs designed by our internal global sales enablement team. This includes: Creating enrollments, cohorts, communications, scheduling invites for net new live enablement programs Support with gathering the requirements across our GTM teams on dashboarding and tooling needsPartner with Enablement Operations to ensure a quality deliverable is designed and user tested with the end userSupport with the training, usage, scaling, and operationalization of new tools and initiatives across the GTM teamsOwn the plan and execution of Datadog’s Knowledge Management System (KMS), defining clear success criteria aligned to business and field needsPartner with cross-functional stakeholders across sales teams to conduct discovery interviews, identify knowledge gaps and pain points, and translate insights into actionable requirements for our knowledge management systemsAssist with reporting on our enablement program metrics to share out with our leadership teamIdentify and support the execution of ways we can embed AI and tooling into to make our operations and processes scale more efficientlyLeverages strategic thinking to uplevel our systems and process for our enablement programsSupport the content build and design for our specific initiative cross functional enablement programs as well as recommend content and program enhancements based on data and survey feedbackEnsure that we scale by creating and carrying out repeatable & measurable processesConsult and assist on a range of special projects and one off tasks as we scale and refine our operating model Who You Are:Have 2-4 years of experience working in learning and enablement, business operations or other equivalent operational experienceExtremely organized and have a strong attention to details, driving toward the most efficient processExperience with Knowledge Management SystemsA strategic thinker who is always looking to improve the status quoExperience with reporting and analysis in Tableau, Google Sheets, etc. Experience with Learning Management Systems, job_title: Senior Atlassian Administrator - Enterprise IT Operations
job_description: The IT Operations - SaaS team is responsible for the SaaS solutions that Datadog employees around the world use on a daily basis to successfully do their jobs. As a Senior Atlassian Administrator for the Enterprise IT Operations - SaaS team, you will serve as the go-to subject matter expert for our Atlassian ecosystem (Confluence and Jira). You will partner closely with cross-functional stakeholders (Engineering, Product, IT Operations, Security, etc.) to architect, maintain, and evolve our Atlassian tooling in support of a global, fast-moving organization. This role elevates the Atlassian domain within the SaaS stack, with responsibility for standards, integrations, automations, governance, and strategic roadmap planning.At Datadog, we place value in our office culture - the relationships and collaboration it builds and the creativity it brings to the table. We operate as a hybrid workplace to ensure our Datadogs can create a work-life harmony that best fits them.What You’ll Do:Serve as the lead SME for all Atlassian systems: architecture, design, configuration, customization, and scaling of Jira and Confluence (and related add-ons/apps).Define and enforce best practices, governance frameworks and security controls for our Atlassian tools (user access, permissions, licensing, change management, audit/compliance).Design and implement advanced workflows, automations, integrations (APIs, webhooks, scripting, add-on architecture) that connect Atlassian tools with other SaaS platforms and internal systems.Collaborate with other SaaS administrators, IT Operations, DevOps, Engineering and Security teams to ensure that Atlassian systems are aligned with broader IT strategy, compliance (e.g., data privacy, access control), disaster recovery, and change management policies.Work with vendor partners and Atlassian-ecosystem solution providers: evaluate new apps/extensions, manage licensing & renewal strategy, negotiate service levels and support escalations.Serve as a point of escalation for the IT Support team on Atlassian related issues and participate in an on-call rotation.Who You Are: You have 3+ years of hands-on experience administering enterprise Atlassian systems in a medium to large organization.You have experience with automation and Atlassian APIs.You are familiar with regulated environments including SOC II, SOX and FedRAMP.You have excellent communication and stakeholder-management skills: you can explain technical concepts to non-technical audiences, lead workshops or training, and partner cross-functionally.You have a passion for learning new tools and technologies while working in a fast-paced, high growth startup environment.Datadog values people from all walks of life. We understand not everyone will meet all the above qualifications on day one. That's okay. If you’re passionate about technology and want to grow your skills, we encourage you to apply.Benefits and Growth:New hire stock equity (RSUs) and employee stock purchase plan (ESPP)Continuous professional development, product training, and career pathingIntradepartmental mentor and buddy program for in-house networkingAn inclusive company culture, ability to join our Community Guilds (Datadog employee resource groups)Access to Inclusion Talks, our internal panel discussionsFree, global mental health benefits for employees and dependents age 6+Competitive global benefitsBenefits and Growth listed above may vary based on the country of your employment and the nature of your employment with Datadog.Datadog offers a competitive salary and equity package, and may include variable compensation. Actual compensation is based on factors such as the candidate's skills, qualifications, and experience. In addition, Datadog offers a wide range of best in class, comprehensive and inclusive employee benefits for this role including healthcare, dental, parental planning, and mental health benefits, a 401(k) plan and match, paid time off, fitness reimbursements, and a discounted employee stock purchase plan.The reasonably estimated yearly salary for this role at Datadog is:$140,000—$180,000 USDAbout Datadog: Datadog (NASDAQ: DDOG) is a global SaaS business, delivering a rare combination of growth and profitability. We are on a mission to break down silos and solve complexity in the cloud age by enabling digital transformation, cloud migration, and infrastructure monitoring of our customers’ entire technology stacks. Built by engineers, for engineers, Datadog is used by organizations of all sizes across a wide range of industries. Together, we champion professional development, diversity of thought, innovation, and work excellence to empower continuous growth. Join the pack and become part of a collaborative, pragmatic, and thoughtful people-first community where we solve tough problems, take smart risks, and celebrate one another. Learn more about #DatadogLife on Instagram, LinkedIn, and Datadog Learning Center.Equal Opportunity at Datadog:Datadog is proud to offer equal employment opportunity to everyone regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity, veteran status, and other characteristics protected by law. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. Here are our Candidate Legal Notices for your reference. Datadog endeavors to make our Careers Page accessible to all users. If you would like to contact us regarding the accessibility of our website or need assistance completing the application process, please complete this form. This form is for accommodation requests only and cannot be used to inquire about the status of applications. Privacy and AI Guidelines:Any information you submit to Datadog as part of your application will be processed in accordance with Datadog’s Applicant and Candidate Privacy Notice. For information on our AI policy, please visit Interviewing at Datadog AI Guidelines.Requisition ID: R16525

job_description: The Legal team supports Datadog's rapid growth by providing a wide range of legal services across a highly dynamic technology company, from driving new business via contracts and compliance efforts, to protecting Datadog's intellectual property. Datadog's Legal team works with virtually every team across the organization, from engineering to product to marketing.Datadog is looking for a business-savvy attorney to provide legal counsel for M&A and other strategic transactions globally, from diligence to execution and integration. As Senior Counsel, you will also support securities law, governance and other corporate matters.At Datadog, we place value in our office culture - the relationships and collaboration it builds and the creativity it brings to the table. We operate as a hybrid workplace to ensure our Datadogs can create a work-life harmony that best fits them.What You'll Do:Oversee and provide legal advice in connection with domestic and international M&A and other transactions, including due diligence, deal structuring, agreement drafting and negotiation, stakeholder presentation materials, and outside counsel managementWork closely with corporate development and other teams on a multi-functional basis, developing trusted relationships to facilitate a coordinated team approachRepresent the Legal Department on post-closing integration mattersDevelop standardized processes and documents to develop scale, efficiency and best practices across M&A and other strategic transactionsSupport public company reporting including the drafting and review of Forms10-K and 10-Q and Section 16 filingsAssist in the preparation for the annual shareholder meeting including drafting of proxy materialsSupport the administration of equity compensation including award agreements and trading plansOversee subsidiary maintenance including entity formation Provide support and guidance on other corporate matters Who You Are: A licensed attorney with at least 5 years of experience in M&A at a nationally recognized law firm Someone with a deep understanding of legal issues in both domestic and cross-border M&A who can be creative and flexible when dealing with complex legal issuesWell-versed in technology companies and startupsDetail-oriented, independent self-starter and able to thrive in a dynamic environmentExperience with public company reporting and equity compensation a plus, but not requiredFlexible and willing to take on different types of projects in a quickly scaling company as neededA strong presenter with an ability to translate legal jargon to plain languageDatadog values people from all walks of life. We understand not everyone will meet all the above qualifications on day one. That's okay. If you’re passionate about technology and want to grow your skills, we encourage you to apply.Benefits & Growth: Generous and competitive benefits packageNew hire stock equity (RSUs) and employee stock purchase planContinuous career development and pathing opportunitiesEmployee-focused best in class onboardingInternal mentor and cross-departmental buddy programFriendly and inclusive workplace cultureBenefits and Growth listed above may vary based on the country of your employment and the nature of your employment with Datadog.Datadog offers a competitive salary and equity package, and may include variable compensation. Actual compensation is based on factors such as the candidate's skills, qualifications, and experience. In addition, Datadog offers a wide range of best in class, comprehensive and inclusive employee benefits for this role including healthcare, dental, parental planning, and mental health benefits, a 401(k) plan and match, paid time off, fitness reimbursements, and a discounted employee stock purchase plan.The reasonably estimated yearly salary for this role at Datadog is:$200,000—$250,000 USDAbout Datadog: Datadog (NASDAQ: DDOG) is a global SaaS business, delivering a rare combination of growth and profitability. We are on a mission to break down silos and solve complexity in the cloud age by enabling digital transformation, cloud migration, and infrastructure monitoring of our customers’ entire technology stacks. Built by engineers, for engineers, Datadog is used by organizations of all sizes across a wide range of industries. Together, we champion professional development, diversity of thought, innovation, and work excellence to empower continuous growth. Join the pack and become part of a collaborative, pragmatic, and thoughtful people-first community where we solve tough problems, take smart risks, and celebrate one another. title: Senior Counsel, Corporate & M&A

job_description: About DatadogDatadog helps developers, data teams, and business users ship and learn fast—combining observability, security, feature flagging, and experimentation into one unified platform. Our tools power innovation across the modern enterprise, helping organizations deliver faster, more reliable digital experiences while continuously learning from their data. We’re growing rapidly and building new capabilities that put Datadog at the forefront of experimentation, inference, and product development tooling.About the TeamEppo, now part of Datadog, is building the experimentation platform that powers the world’s most innovative companies—including Coinbase, Perplexity, and DraftKings. Our team of experimenters helps organizations run trustworthy, high-velocity experiments that drive real business outcomes. We bring cutting-edge causal inference methods to bear across a wide range of experiment types and literacy levels, from simple A/B tests to advanced techniques like holdouts, bandits, and synthetic controls. As part of the Eppo Solutions team within Datadog, you’ll work closely with customers to help them succeed with experimentation—guiding them through design, interpretation, and operational best practices, and ensuring that experimentation becomes a core capability within their business. You’ll be at the forefront of shaping how the world’s leading companies run experiments at scale. At Datadog, you’ll join a collaborative, growth-oriented environment with competitive salary, equity, and benefits—where your expertise in data science and experimentation directly contributes to the success of our customers and our business.At Datadog, we place value in our office culture - the relationships and collaboration it builds, and the creativity it brings to the table. We operate as a hybrid workplace to ensure our Datadogs can create a work-life harmony that best fits them.What You’ll DoServe as a technical and analytical partner to customers evaluating Datadog’s experimentation capabilities during pre-sales engagements.Support proofs of concept by helping customers configure metrics, validate data pipelines, and design statistically sound experiments.Educate customers on best practices in experiment design, metric definition, and interpretation—spanning product A/B tests, marketing lifecycle tests, pricing and packaging, and AI/ML experimentation.Provide post-sales enablement and training, ensuring customers adopt strong analytical and experimental habits within Eppo and Datadog.Collaborate with Product and Engineering to represent customer feedback and influence product direction.Partner with Sales and Solutions leadership to identify opportunities, overcome objections, and build champions within customer organizations.Contribute to internal documentation, playbooks, and presentations that raise the bar for data-driven experimentation across the company.Who You AreYou have 4+ years of professional data science experience with a strong foundation in statistics, inference, and experimental design.You have run many A/B experiments across multiple companies or products, and are comfortable applying advanced methods such as holdouts, bandits, synthetic controls, or geolift tests.You’re fluent in SQL and experienced enough with data engineering concepts to diagnose issues in customer data warehouses and pipelines.You thrive in customer-facing settings—able to communicate complex analytical ideas clearly, handle objections thoughtfully, and build trust with both technical and non-technical audiences.You are an active listener, able to sense what’s said and what’s not said in conversations, and you adjust your approach accordingly.You enjoy teaching, simplifying, and elevating others’ analytical capabilities.You are motivated by impact—you want your work to influence real business outcomes like customer success, win rates, and revenue growth.Preferred QualificationsExperience supporting enterprise customers in a solutions, pre-sales, or consulting capacity.Familiarity with tools like dbt, Airflow, or similar analytics orchestration systems.Prior exposure to B2B SaaS or cloud infrastructure analytics environments.Demonstrated thought leadership in experimentation—talks, posts, or internal education initiatives.Datadog values people from all walks of life. We understand not everyone will meet all the above qualifications on day one. That's okay. If you’re passionate about technology and want to grow your skills, we encourage you to apply.Benefits & GrowthNew hire stock equity (RSUs) and employee stock purchase plan (ESPP)Continuous professional development, product training, and career pathingIntra-departmental mentor and buddy program for in-house networkingAn inclusive company culture, with the ability to join our Community GuildsAccess to Inclusion Talks, our internal panel discussionsFree, global Spring Health benefits for employees and dependents age 6+Competitive global benefitsBenefits and Growth listed above may vary based on the country of your employment and the nature of your employment with Datadog.Datadog offers a competitive salary and equity package, and may include variable compensation. Actual compensation is based on factors such as the candidate's skills, qualifications, and experience. In addition, Datadog offers a wide range of best in class, comprehensive and inclusive employee benefits for this role including healthcare, dental, parental planning, and mental health benefits, a 401(k) plan and match, paid time off, fitness reimbursements, and a discounted employee stock purchase plan.The reasonably estimated yearly salary for this role at Datadog is:$187,000—$240,000 USDAbout Datadog: Datadog (NASDAQ: DDOG) is a global SaaS business, delivering a rare combination of growth and profitability. We are on a mission to break down silos and solve complexity in the cloud age by enabling digital transformation, cloud migration, and infrastructure monitoring of our customers’ entire technology stacks. Built by engineers, for engineers, Datadog is used by organizations of all sizes across a wide range of industries. Together, we champion professional development, diversity of thought, innovation, and work excellence to empower continuous growth. Join the pack and become part of a collaborative, pragmatic, and thoughtful people-first community where we solve tough problems, take smart risks, and celebrate one another. title: Senior Customer Data Scientist

job_description: Datadog is seeking a seasoned design leader to accelerate the evolution of its core products and help us define what’s next. These products power how engineers visualize, optimize and troubleshoot complex, distributed systems at scale. In this role, you’ll lead a 40-person design team across North America and Europe, shaping how often the invisible world of infrastructure becomes understandable, navigable, actionable and deeply human. It’s an opportunity to craft the design vision for our customers to see, interpret, and act on live data—transforming dense technical signals into experiences that feel clear, intuitive, and empowering.At Datadog, we place value in our office culture - the relationships and collaboration it builds and the creativity it brings to the table. We operate as a hybrid workplace to ensure our Datadogs can create a work-life harmony that best fits them. This role is based in New York. What you’ll do:Grow, mentor, and lead a talented and diverse team of global design managers and product designers. Partner with cross-functional partners to establish roadmaps, metrics, and goals.Help the team to Design ahead and set the vision for the user experience to meet customer and business needs. Guide and accelerate your team, oversee multiple workstreams, and connect the dots between cross-org products for your team to deliver a cohesive customer experience.Be the champion for product excellence.You’ll report to the Head of Design and work with peer leaders to strengthen our processes, tools, and design organization.Who You Are:15 years experience in product design with 8 years experience managing managers.Strong experience and portfolio that showcases a track record of design leadership, end-to-end experience ownership, and design excellence. Strong customer advocacy with a penchant for data and business-informed design.Experience of building complex products. Experience of building B2B saas products is desirable but not required.Ability to dabble in the technical breadth and depth of modern software development.Datadog values people from all walks of life. We understand not everyone will meet all the above qualifications on day one. That's okay. If you’re passionate about technology and want to grow your skills, we encourage you to apply. Benefits and Growth:New hire stock equity (RSUs) and employee stock purchase plan (ESPP)Continuous professional development, product training, and career pathingIntradepartmental mentor and buddy program for in-house networkingAn inclusive company culture, ability to join our Community Guilds (Datadog employee resource groups)Access to Inclusion Talks, our internal panel discussionsFree, global mental health benefits for employees and dependents age 6+Competitive global benefitsBenefits and Growth listed above may vary based on the country of your employment and the nature of your employment with Datadog.Datadog offers a competitive salary and equity package, and may include variable compensation. Actual compensation is based on factors such as the candidate's skills, qualifications, and experience.
